ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 8
ygData.msgSnippet: unsubscribe ... Internet? ... Internet! ... net goto www.everquest.com ... had a problem with the binding issue.. If you didnt notice the spell bind takes a
ygData.messageBody:
unsubscribe

>Reply-To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQCheats] Digest Number 8
>Date: 24 Apr 1999 12:35:08 -0000
>

Internet?

Internet!

net goto www.everquest.com

>

>
> 1. Re: Hrmmm..

>Message: 1
> Date: Fri, 23 Apr 1999 10:36:24 -0400
> From: Warthog <warthog@...>
>Subject: Re: Hrmmm..
>
>> Well, there goes my theory about not having to be all
>> that concerned about who I team up with.
>> Grouping with someone was my way to get to know them...
>
>That works for levels under 12, hehe. After that they can mess you up
>with Affinity Bind. Only of course if you go into a city with them.
>
>
>_____________________________________________________________________
__________
>_____________________________________________________________________
__________
>
>Message: 2
> Date: Fri, 23 Apr 1999 17:40:19 -0400
> From: "dlobdell" <dlobdell@...>
>Subject: Re: Hrmmm..
>
>
>Ok first of all i have been in EQ since phase 1 beta and i've never
had a problem with the binding issue.. If you didnt notice the spell
bind takes a considerable amount of time to cast and you could most
likely flee far enough away to counter it... Of course if your that
paranoid about it happening then you may have other under lying
problems +AD0-) And even if it was to happen, its most likely not
life threatening...
>Concering the Casting invis on a pet, the pevious post was correct
it is a bannable offence and largely looked down upon...
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Warthog warthog+AEA-ooz.net
>To: EQCheats+AEA-onelist.com EQCheats+AEA-onelist.com
>Date: Friday, April 23, 1999 10:55 AM
>Subject: +AFs-EQCheats+AF0- Re: Hrmmm..
>
>
>From: Warthog warthog+AEA-ooz.net
>
>+AD4APg- Well, there goes my theory about not having to be all
>+AD4APg- that concerned about who I team up with.
>+AD4APg- Grouping with someone was my way to get to know them...
>
>That works for levels under 12, hehe. After that they can mess
you up
>with Affinity Bind. Only of course if you go into a city with
them.

>Message: 3
> Date: Sat, 24 Apr 1999 03:51:37 -0500
> From: Enigma <enigma@...>
>Subject: Re: Hrmmm..
>
>Actually Gather shadows works too but that is a self only and is
your own
>fault. I don't think it is clever since you can just walk up on some
one
>and do it. One SOB on Fen Ro does it a lot any time he sees some one
with a
>pet he Invisi's them, he of course waits till they are in a fight.
He is
>also the type of guy who casts see Invisible on guards so they will
kill
>and dark characters using the spell.
>
><-- Enigma -->
>http://members.door.net/enigma
>
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Warthog [SMTP:warthog@...]
>Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 7:20 AM
>To: EQCheats@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQCheats] Re: Hrmmm..
>
>From: Warthog <warthog@...>
>
>> Someone could "bind affinity" to you where you would get killed
after
>getting killed.
>
>Bah that is no exploit. In order for someone to bind you, two
conditions
>must be met. First and foremost, they have to be in your party.
Being in
>your party means you trust them (or that you are a frickin idiot to
join
>their party without knowing them) and give consent. The second
condition
>is that a spellcaster can only bind people in city areas (Highhold
Pass
>is considered a city however).
>
>> If you have a pet and someone makes you invisible, the pet goes
away.
>
>This works on all classes cept Necromancers, which you have to use
>Invisible to Undead on. Most consider it an exploit, I think it's
just
>damn clever.
>

>Message: 4
> Date: Sat, 24 Apr 1999 03:55:20 -0500
> From: Enigma <enigma@...>
>Subject: Re: Hrmmm..
>
>Heh since early beta, in fact me and others found the first 2 dupe
>exploits, one involved dyeing with items in a sack and the other
trading
>while crossing a zone boundary, we also pissed a lot of people off
cause we
>reported it. Verant was VERY good to plug up most of these hole but
not
>every one is possible.
><-- Enigma -->
>Tech Supervisor of The Door ISP
>http://members.door.net/enigma
>UIN:364996
>
>
>

>

then
>you REALLY need to pull your head out of your ass.

>Message: 7
> Date: Sat, 24 Apr 1999 04:49:56 -0500
> From: Ken Rubenzer <kenr@...>
>Subject: Re: Hrmmm..
>
>I thought I already posted that about the charm? Very effective
trick to
>help enchanters along in the levs. :-)
>
>BTW I never thought of casting see invis on a guard!
>
>Would that be cheap or roleplaying? You are helping the local law
>enforcment keep the outlaws out of the town?
>
>Is that cheap?
>
>About duping, I was able to dupe another way in phase 3, other than
the two
>ways you hinted at. Very similar to the force crash while using a
moongate
>in UO. I in fact talked to brad in game, as he wanted proof the dupe
could
>be down. I was able to duplicate the effect to dupe a rusty dagger.
I have
>been unable to acchieve the same effect now in final. It involved
waiting
>for the Character save message then forcing a Link Dead Crash of
your game
>after dropping an item on the ground. Have a friend pick up the
item. When
>you log back on your previous save would be restored, with the item
you
>dropped. THIS DOES NOT WORK now. It seems that a save is done
everytime you
>complete a transaction, or drop something or loot something, etc. I
did do
>a linkdead while having the trade window up. I lost the item for
good, so
>that did not work well.
>
>I am confident there are no valid dupe bugs out there, and frankly I
am
>happy for that. However giving enough work some one will find one.
>
>Just my thoughts,
>
>Ken
>
